data.title: Switching document tab makes 'Remove Unnecessary Usings' pops up.
data.body:
_From @antonkudin on February 8, 2017 0:31_

- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.10.0-insider (87fd1dde6d2d2b0d84c3fe56fabc174e888b0024, 2017-02-07T07:05:01.586Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.4.0
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|csharpfixformat|Leopotam|0.0.9|
|unity-tools|Tobiah|0.1.9|
|unity-snippets|YclepticStudios|0.1.2|
|csharp|ms-vscode|1.6.2|
|theme-actual-obsidian|zehfernando|2.1.0|

---

Switching document tab makes 'Remove Unnecessary Usings' pops up.

![2017-02-07 22_21_43](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8632082/22717955/f4af5e3c-edae-11e6-8764-75585ad42c61.gif)

It also seems like having top line in a document be one of the unused 'using'-s makes it appear (it appears underlined in green). Doesn't happen if top 'using' is actually important for this document's code.

Tested it by adding unnecessary 'using' to a c# document, at the top line, and pop up started to appear when switching to that document.

Steps to Reproduce:
Click other tab, cmd+alt+direction to switch or cmd+number to create new window.

_Copied from original issue: OmniSharp/omnisharp-vscode#1203_

data.title: [less] problem with '&-2' selector
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9.0
- OS Version: Windows 10 x64

Hi, I have ignored all less warning like this:

`"less.lint.emptyRules": "ignore",
    "less.lint.fontFaceProperties": "ignore",
    "less.lint.hexColorLength": "ignore",
    "less.lint.argumentsInColorFunction": "ignore",

http://i.imgur.com/W1cVhpJ.png
How i can ignore it?

data.title: Option to insert comment // characters at column zero

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9.0
- OS Version: Windows 10 x64

(Following [this Stack Overflow question](http://stackoverflow.com/q/42192341/24874))

I miss the code commenting behaviour from Visual Studio (possibly via R#). That is, when you comment a line of code, the `//` characters are injected at the gutter.

For me, this distinguishes commented code from documentation.

I would like an option that allows this.

_Steps to Reproduce:_

1. Position the caret on a line that has indented code
2. Invoke the comment line command (i.e. <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>/</kbd>)
3. Notice that the inserted `//` is not in column zero, but is indented as much as the code was

data.title: [Javascript] Syntax highlighting breaks for specific variable name
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.9.1 (f9d0c687ff2ea7aabd85fb9a43129117c0ecf519, 2017-02-09T00:26:45.394Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.2.5|
|contextualduplicate|lafe|0.2.0|
|cpptools|ms-vscode|0.10.1|
|seti-icons|qinjia|0.1.3|

---
For some reason, for a specific name, VS code stops highlighting one specific token after a certain line in the file. The file is not terribly long (303 lines), no lines are terribly long, and the name is syntax highlighted on one line (light blue), not syntax highlighted on the next (white). In this instance the variable name is `path`. Changing the name to something else highlights appropriately, but it does not fix the problem as changing it back to `path` breaks it again. I have no idea how it gets in this state, so I can't really provide steps to reproduce, it seems completely arbitrary.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5589147/22865712/abdb83ca-f11e-11e6-807c-063f5126e0ce.png)

data.title: Erroneous TypeScript compiler error
Inspect TM Scopes is not designed for big code.
data.body: os: sierra vscode: latest and greatest! Take [this code](https://github.com/karyfoundation/karyscript/blob/master/src/compiler/grammar/grammar.pegjs#L1705-L1736). When you try to inspect the tokenizer's scopes you'll end up with this: I'm not sure if it's even worthy of getting investigated but well a simple box sizing can fix it I think

data.title: Can't parse global variable in TypeScript
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.9.1
- OS Version:
```
Distributor ID:	Ubuntu
Description:	Ubuntu 16.10
Release:	16.10
Codename:	yakkety
```

 If anyone has the same problem, please set `+1` to express you have, too.

I have a question. I had declared a global variable in Typescript. Why can't  IDE properly parse?

example:

a_module.js
```js
global.this_is_a_constant = 100;
```

a_module.d.ts
```js
declare var this_is_a_constant: number;
```

When I tried to import it and call it,
```js
import 'a_module';
console.log(this_is_a_constant)
```

it will show error message:
```
[ts] Cannot find name 'this_is_a_constant'.
any
```

But in Nodejs, it can correctly process and output on terminal.

Is it a bug?

data.title: C++ custom class names not highlighted
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.9.1
- OS Version: macOS 10.12.3

Steps to Reproduce:

1. open a C++ file, type in:
```C++
class A {
private:
  int x;
public:
  A(int _x) {
	  x = _x;
  }
  A operator+(A &a) {
	  x++;
	  return *this;
  }
  A operator*(int c) {
	  x *= c;
	  return *this;
  }
  int get_value() {
	  return x;
  }
};

int main() {
	A a = A(1);
	return 0;
}
```
2. The class name "A" will not be highlighted the same way other built-in types (like "int") are, in lines like "A operator+(A &a)" and "A a = A(1)". But in Visual Studio custom class names are highlighted. 
3. Similar: #4948

Thanks
